Header: Sri Lanka’s biggest export processing zone commences
Content: The work on Sri Lanka’s biggest export processing zone in Bingiriya will commence tomorrow under the patronage of Prime Minister Ranil Wickremasingh. This is the first time after 15 years such an export processing zone would be built.The Bingiriya Export Processing Zone will be developed under three stages. In the first stage 164 acres will be developed and 25 new industries will be setup. 10.000 direct job opportunities and 3,000 indirect job opportunities would be created through that. In the second stage new industries will be established at 282 acres in Gorakagas-ara area. 25,000 direct and 10,000 indirect jobs are expected to be created in the second stage. Developing of 1,200 acres of the Export Processing Zone will be done at the third and final stage. It will create 75,000 direct employment opportunities. The development project of the Bingiriya Export Processing Zone is expected to be completed between 8 and 12 years. Deputy Minister Nalin Bandara said that this Export Processing Zone will perform a major task to strengthen the economy of the country.
